result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer L Droster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 11:06am [ma]
Defendant Jennifer L Droster in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.  DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Amended Information
--Atty. Rhiel admits service; waives reading

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #3 and #4 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #1 and #2

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
Statement made by Ms. Droster

On Counts #3 and #4 of the Amended Information, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--On Count #3: to serve 10 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber and work-release privileges, to commence FORTHWITH
--This jail term may be transfered to Dane County, so long as it is served without electronic monitoring
---Ms. Droster is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--maintain absolute sobriety
--not to possess or consume alcohol or illegal drugs
--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or as deemed appropriate per Agent
--to pay statutory costs and $25 drug testing fee
--to submit DNA sample upon demand

The Court does NOT find Ms. Droster eligible for expungement
The Court does NOT suspend Mr. Droster's driving privileges

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 11:22am
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 11:12am. 
Defendant Jennifer L Droster in court with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Plea and Sentencing today, however Attorney Rhiel requests adjournment to later this week, to give Ms. Droster time to make arrangements for her 18 year old daughter who is still in high school and also for employment, in anticipation of forthwith incarceration. 
The Court adourns.  Counsel agree to the new date of Wednesday, October 12th
recess 11:14am.

NEXT:  rescheduled Plea/Sentencing on Wednesday October 12th at 11:00am

Case called at 4:00 pm [sf]
Defendant Jennifer L Droster in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause.
Court reviews scrivernors error Count #2 is listed as Count #4.
No objection from ADA Shock for the Court to amend by it's own hand.
Court reviews that it had adjourned the initial appearance to allow her time to seek counsel, inquires if the defendant has sought counsel.
Defendant advises that she forget to seek counsel.

Court will adjourn this matter, Court orders that the defendant report to the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office tomorrow as a condition of her bond. 
Court advises that if she does not qualify for SPD representation, she should submit a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.

recess: 4:07 pm
